Sure, here are some fun facts about snakes that you might not know:

1. Snakes can see pretty well, despite what many people think: Although snakes don't have eyelids, they have relatively good vision, and many species can see up to a distance of 30 meters.

2. Most snakes are not venomous: In fact, only about 15% of snake species are venomous, and most of these are not dangerous to humans. Pet snakes, in particular, are often non-venomous species.

3. Snakes can detect prey even when they can't see it: Some species of snakes have specialized sensors on their faces that allow them to detect the body heat of their prey, even in the dark.

4. Snakes have a unique mode of movement: Snakes are capable of several different types of movement, such as slithering, sidewinding, and even flying (in some species). Some snakes can also move at speeds of up to 20 miles per hour.

5. Some snakes are cold-blooded, while others aren't: Despite what many people think, not all snakes are cold-blooded. Some species, like the boa constrictor, are able to regulate their body temperature internally.

These are just a few fun facts about snakes that demonstrate the amazing capabilities of these fascinating creatures!
